He felt both frightened and pleased to be riding alone with three hussars into that mysterious and dangerous misty distance where no one had been before him. Bagrati6n called to him from the hill not to go beyond the stream, but Ros- tdv pretended not to hear him and did not stop but rodeon and on, continually mistaking bushes for trees and gullies for men and con- tinually discovering his mistakes.
